cheatsheet.title: Creating and configuring a Master Plate

intro.description: This tutorial explains how a Plate is created and how results are imported and connected with that plate. It also explains how the results can be examined.

item.title: Show the Brunn View
item.description: All things stored in the Brunn database can be viewed using the Brunn view. In order to show this view click Window -> Show View -> Other... and choose Brunn Explorer view in the Brunn category.

item.title: Log In
item.description: In order to access what is stored in the Brunn database you need to sign in with your username and password. This can be done by right clicking in the Brunn view where it says "Not Logged In" and select Log In or by File -> Log In.

item.title: Create Plate
item.description: Right click on Plates or a sub folder to Plates in the Brunn view and select Create Plate. In the dialog that pops up give your new Plate a name, choose a Master Plate to base it on, either a cell sample or a patient sample and enter the plates barcode which will be used when importing data for it.

item.title: Opening the Import Results Wizard
item.description: Results are imported into Brunn by clicking Import Results from File in the menu for the Brunn View. To open this menu click the little triangle in the upper right corner of the Brunn Explorer view.

item.title: Choosing Results File
item.description: In the first wizard page click Browse and locate the file to import and click OK. Brunn supports imports from three different file formats. Two of them are file formats of files generated by machines and the third one is CSV files.

item.title: Select Plates to Import
item.description: The next wizard page looks a bit different depending on what file was used. If the file contained barcodes makes sure that the plate to be imported really exists in the database and check the box next to it to import it when Finish is clicked. However if the file does not contain that barcode or if the barcode reader has failed to read the barcode the barcode must be added manually. Select the row representing the plate to be imported and right click and choose Change barcode. Once the wizard page reports that the plate with the given barcode exists in the database results can be imported for it.

item.title: Opening the Plate Editor to View Results
item.description: When data has been imported for a plate it can be viewed using the Plate editor. Locate the plate in the Brunn Explorer and doubleclick it to open it in the Plate Editor.

item.title: The Overview tab in the Plate Editor
item.description:
The overview tab shows the values for the plate as they are organized on the actual plate. In the right end there is a list of all markers and another one of all plate functions. Selecting a marker will select the cells corresponding to the wells with that marker. At the bottom of the editor there is a combo box for showing different well functions in the big table and to the right there is a button for marking selected wells as outliers. The results can be copied (to be pasted in for example Excel) by clicking the Copy data to Clipboard button.
To switch to the Summary tab click Summary in the bottom left corner of the editor.

item.title: The Summary tab in the Plate Editor
item.description:
The Summary tab shows all well functions for all wells and som more info. Wells can be marked as outliers by selecting the row corresponding to a well and clicking the Mark as outlier button in the bottom part of the editor.The table can be copied (to be pasted in for example Excel) by clicking the Copy Table to Clipboard button.
To switch to the Average tab click Average in the bottom left corner of the editor.

item.title: The Average tab in the Plate Editor
item.description:
The Average tab shows a similar table to the Summary tab but it has mashed together all replicates and shows the averages for them.
To switch to the IC50 tab click IC50 in the bottom left corner of the editor.

item.title: The IC50 tab in the Plate Editor
item.description:
This tab shows the estimated IC50 values for the compounds.
To switch to the report tab click Report in the bottom left corner of the editor.

item.title: The Report tab in the Plate Editor
item.description: The report tab contains a report with plots and numbers. It can be exported in multiple formats and hopefully printed from one of those exported formats. To export, click the export icon (fourth from the left) and choose a format and export.
